commitmsg: hooked in help/errors
minor tweak to set up a white line at the top of the page
applied restyle to toolness's lovebomb skeleton instead
updated to support new API that takes html, original-url POST args.
Fixed webpagemaker #20, 'Stub slightly mangles whitespacing in published HTML'. Right now we only fix a very narrow range of whitespace mangles, though.
fixed bugs introduced by refactoring.
more minor refactorings to tests
minor refactoring to tests
split out MarkTracker and LivePreview tests into multiple different tests
split out ParsingCodeMirror tests into multiple different tests
split out IndexableCodeMirror tests into multiple different tests
better cleanup for LivePreview test
added LivePreview test
added descriptive messages to tests
added tests for MarkTracker
added test for cursor activity to ParsingCodeMirror tests
added tests for IndexableCodeMirror and ParsingCodeMirror
moved all editor app-specific logic out of editor.js and into a new file, main.js.
Updated slowparse version.
undo/redo buttons now fade out when there is no undo/redo history.

Made parachute mechanism (hopefully) a bit more intuitive: we now load the last user content on a per-page basis, e.g. we store a separate saved template for '/?p=blarg' vs. '/?p=foo'. We load the saved content "on top" of the original page in the undo buffer, so if the user wants to go back to the original and unmodified version of the page, they can click undo.
Insert a BASE TARGET tag into the preview frame so that links clicked in it don't replace the preview frame content.

Added a 'parachute' which restores the user's data from last time. It's a bit of a privacy headache for people who don't want the next user to see their work--though it can be obviated by clearing the page content and then reloading--but the benefits of not losing one's hard work far outweigh those concerns at the moment.
immediately show preview of a loaded mission/remix when it's loaded, rather than waiting 300 ms.
Added a 'please wait, loading...' message while the editor is loading a mission/remix.
switched help messaging to use underscore.js templating, which simplifies code a lot.
simplified code for makeSelectorMatchesHelp() function.
help area for CSS selectors now shows the # of elements that match the selector.
Fixed #4, "Preview area's scroll position always resets to top-left of page when content is changed".

the editor now displays the page preview even if errors are detected in the page, which should help both with missions that involve intentionally malformed HTML as well as slowparse 'false positives'.
factored publishing UI from publishing network code.
refactored publish.js a bit; all its dependencies are passed into it via a constructor function now. Might want to decouple it from UI later on.
increased size of footer so that two lines of help/error can fit.
removed hyperlink from banner to avoid opening editor in a new tab due to base href.
publishing works again.
hooked up undo/redo buttons
Fixed error message highlighting of word 'here' broken by 46b8f4e6ad8bcf500fc24b8dc55848cae4a3e8bd.

Fixed #2 by merging lovebomb.me's CSS with friendlycode. lovebomb.me works on IE8/opera/firefox/webkit, so it should work fine for all our use cases (though IE8 support requires an HTML5 shim, which I haven't included here). This also obviates the need for some of the codemirror "imitation" images.
moved code around a bit to make it more readable.
Converted the Editor class into a subclass of IndexableCodeMirror called ParsingCodeMirror.
Factored out preview logic from Editor and moved it to a separate class that is notified of editor changes via Backbone.Events.
Factored out error help logic from Editor and moved it to a separate class that is notified of editor changes via Backbone.Events.
Factored out context-sensitive help logic from Editor and moved it to a separate class that is notified of editor changes via Backbone.Events.
Added underscore and backbone libraries.
encapsulated editor functionality into its own class.

Disabling the goggle fonts for now; The browser blocks on them, which for localhost dev setups on slow internet connections really hurts. Once we decide on a permanent font, we can add it to the repository so it's locally hosted, or we can add logic that makes the browser not block on the loading of the fonts.
Changed implementation to use CodeMirror() constructor instead of CodeMirror.fromTextArea, which does weird magic that we don't really need for the editor.
replaced the getIndexFromPos() function with a simple subclass of CodeMirror that makes it easier to operate using character indices.
removed select-text-on-error-highlight-mouseover functionality, which isn't terribly useful.
Replaced hacky mark logic with a new MarkTracker class, which makes the code easier to understand.
added test for Index.clear()
Forgot to remove suggestion-related HTML in 3614bccb6a7928194fd5c5e1167b6e88a2e59f63.
more tests for help.js, fixes to make them work.
Added tests for help.js.
Factored out context-sensitive help functionality into a separate file, help.js.
removed TODOs at top of editor.js, they were aspirational.
Removing suggestion-related code right now, as we're not displaying it. This simplifies the code for refactoring. We can add it back in later if we want.
Added README.md.
Added slowparse submodule.

Origination.

Code taken from https://github.com/toolness/slowparse/tree/fde44c10773e6aab7c771345020bd4eded0e6858/demo/editor.

refresh event every time the preview content changes. This can be used by

	js/main.js
	js/share.js
fixed default remix URL for cases when UI is served from a non-directory-root URL, or when the UI is served from a page whose base href is different from the current page.
fixed bug in my last commit.
avoid DRY violation in publish url passing
put publish URL in HTML, so dynamic servers can change its value easily. temporary workaround to make friendlycode hostable in django.
changed title to Mozilla Webpage Maker.
fixed a few bugs in HTML tagging of index.html.
added a base href tag for django servers to change, as an easy 'hack' for now.
made social media load on mouseover
Updated slowparse version.
Use ES5 strict mode on all our own JS files, reducing the possibility of accidental globals, etc.

Removed late-socials.js's reference to $("#share-container"); it's now passed in, so that the code is completely decoupled from index.html.

Used $.each() to iterate over the keys in socialMedia, avoiding the need for another non-inline function (and its associated comments).

Also removed accidental 'medium' global.

Changed the constructor signature for SocialMedia() so that a function called getURL() is passed in, which returns the URL to share (the original purpose of 'selector' was confusing me so I thought getURL() was more straightforward).

Don't refresh the parachute's original data value immediately after restoring saved user data; it might be the case, for instance, that a user activates the parachute but doesn't touch their open tab for 10 minutes (perhaps because they are reading it), then accidentally closes it, in which case they'll probably want to see their old data when they open the page again.

In other words, we only really want to purge the parachute data if the user hasn't looked at it for more than 5 minutes.

Now using lscache (see https://github.com/pamelafox/lscache) to store saved pages for 5 minutes. This should help limit the surprise factor ("why is my page from 3 days ago still in here?") and reduce privacy concerns ("whoa, look at this crazy thing the last user did!") while still helping users with the most frustrating use cases (accidentally closing tabs/browsers/etc). Using lscache also helps ensure that we don't bloat the user's localStorage.

Added tipsy jquery plugin, and displaying a tooltip when restoring saved content that says "We've restored your changes to this page from earlier, but you can click this button to undo them."  It disappears after 6 seconds.  This is just a temporary stopgap to avoid confusing users until we figure out a better solution.

Changing the cursor help highlight color to white for now, as it's very hard for me to dogfood the editor due to #8.

Also removed the !important property, which was overriding the text selection highlight background color, making it impossible to see what your selection was regardless of the cursor help highlight color.
renamed lateSocials.js -> late-socials.js.
FaceBook -> Facebook

fix for https://github.com/mozilla/webpagemaker/issues/160

Use URL hash instead of querystring for page edit info.

However, this is different from #34, which purports to add full support
for changing the editor's content at runtime when the URL unexpectedly
changes. This fix does "half" of that by changing the URL hash without
reloading *only in expected ways*, e.g. when the user publishes work.
When the URL hash changes unexpectedly, however, we force a full page
reload.

In other words, this is like b56103e85a65c383d2685d6e8dff3301b3fe37c9,
but adds support for IE9 and other browsers that don't support
history.pushState().

Pragmatic pushState() fix for making role of address bar URL clearer.

This is not the same as #30, which aims to add full support for
pushState(). Instead, here we implement "half" of that, using pushState()
when the user publishes their work--to ensure that the page is what
they expect it to be if they share/bookmark their URL. HOWEVER, if the
user clicks the back button, we just issue a full-page reload, since the
rest of the code isn't built for unexpected URL changes yet.

Because it relies on pushState(), this doesn't work on IE9 yet.

Potential solution for #32 which shows page title in nav bar.

This is just a proposal; the amount of code changes were small enough that
I figured I could just commit it for now and we can roll it back if folks
dislike it.

Fixed #31 and #19. The back button is now unbroken!

Also ran the QUnit test suite on the latest versions of Safari, Opera,
Chrome, and Firefox on OS X and IE9 on Windows. Everything passes and
the editor works.

Fixed modal dialog in #165, but Opera and IE9 still don't load reliably.

There's some kind of weird race condition going on when they're
loading resources. Continuously reloading the page eventually will
result in a load that happens to load everything in the right order
and be successful, but frequently things load in the wrong order and
the app breaks.

Show tag help if cursor is on character after tag name.

Because the cursor appears between characters, this means that
it can be positioned immediately after a tag name but still
look like it is "on" the tag name, since it borders on the
last character of the tag name.

Only display error messages after one second of no editor content changes.

Much better indication for error targets ("here" labels).

Specifically, the first "here" is not highlighted at all because
the error message is pointing at it. The second "here" appears
hyperlinked, and if the user clicks on it, the cursor position
is set to the location, and an animated red arrow appears to
guide the user's eye towards it.

Error messages point at first occurrence of the word "here".

Previously, they pointed at the earliest error highlight, which wasn't necessarily the
most helpful thing to point at.

Merge pull request #79 from toolness/relocator-refactoring

Relocator refactoring
removed extraneous border CSS (it's overridden a few lines down).
rename maybeFlipElement() to flipElementIfNeeded().

Remove gutter line arrow, just use red background for now instead.

This fixes the following bug, "Gutter line marker is only one line
tall and points to wrong place":

https://github.com/mozilla/webpagemaker/issues/335

Fixed disembodied down-arrow on error/help messages.

This bug was introduced in 9215adb886028a7fa4935ca391bee97914a5bdcc
due to the addition of border-box box-sizing to the error/help message
containers.
Position error/help arrow horizontally to point at relevant character.

Point error/help messages at the correct soft-wrapped line.

Because we're using soft-wrapped lines, it can be the case that an error
or help message is pointing at a line that is several physical screen
lines down from where the line of code actually starts. Until now,
the messages always pointed at the first physical screen line, which
meant that it sometimes obscured the actual character it was supposed
to be pointing at.

I also made the error/help messages overlap the gutter, in part because
this will make the errors display better on narrow screens, and in part
because this will allow us to actually have the arrow point at the
relevant character in question.

Use percentage width for error/help messages so they don't get
hidden behind the right edge of the editor on narrow screens.
display error/help messages above target line if necessary.
completely decouple Relocator from index.html.

Simplified relocator by using more CodeMirror methods.

Specifically, used CodeMirror's addWidget(), setLineClass(), and
setMarker() to obviate the need for lots of custom DOM/style
manipulation that will potentially break when we upgrade
CodeMirror.

Because we're now using setLineClass(), this also resolves
we set on lines.

There are still a few wonky things going on with this commit, such
as the fact that information always appears below the line that
help displays on, and sometimes this results in weird scrolling
jumps, but we can resolve this in later commits.
Merge branch 'gh-pages' of github.com:toolness/friendlycode into gh-pages
Publish button is no longer faded-out.

Merge pull request #78 from brianloveswords/77-protocol-relative-urls

Use protocol-relative urls for external resources.

Use protocol-relative urls for external resources.

(addresses issue #77, tracking #wpm/301)

We need to use protocol relative URLs for our external resources so
browsers don't complain that we're serving mixed content. This will
fix the problem by serving the secure resource only when needed.

Nav bar text is no longer selectable.

This fixes #243.

Display optional note informing users that their published page can go away.

This note is only displayed if the deployment type is detected as
'development', which is the default. A real server can serve the
index.html with the deployment type changed if they don't want the
message displayed.

Merge pull request #76 from toolness/consistent-toolbar-ui

Consistent toolbar ui

Disabled toolbar buttons are now 33% opaque instead of invisible.

Also refactored toolbar CSS a bit and changed styles in HTML so they
are a bit more semantically accurate, which allows us to
simplify the CSS further.

Applied consistent disabled/enabled/hover styling to toolbar buttons.

As mentioned in #75, they are now as follows:

* **disabled** - don't even show the button; just make it invisible.
* **enabled** - show the button's text and icon in gray.
* **hovering** - show the button's text and icon in blue.
